text: This movie surprisingly REALLY interested me.  I was expecting it to be boring, or cheesy, or filled with bad writing, but it was none of those things.  I genuinely laughed at multiple points, and it accomplished something that horror movies usually don't do for me: it spiked my heart rate a little.
Too derivative and uneven, despite its strengths (namely the nucleus of main characters).
I loved it! But i'm not putting 5 stars because the sequel was even better

I love this entire trilogy, literally the only negative that I have with this movie is that it doesn’t really feel like 1994, but that’s literally it, everything else about this movie is awesome, I love the romance in this movie, I love the characters, and oh my god the gore is amazing! Overall, I highly recommend the entire fear Street trilogy!
Love the whole timeline and story but wish it would have been a better finale and mid way. Overall a great movie

This horror movie was great. Kiana Madeira, Olivia Scott Welch, Julia Rehwald, Benjamin Flores Jr., Fred Hechinger, and the rest of the cast did a great job in this movie. The plot of the movie was thrilling, entertaining, and unexpected. It's about a curse that terrorizes a town where normal people become psycho killers. If you haven't seen this movie yet, check it out sometime. It's worth watching.
Watched while studying for HSC
90's nostalgia starts wearing thin after 20 minutes. Not much else to see here except shrill, annoying, cheesily-acted paper-thin characters
Loved the old school slasher vibe

A decent, well-crafted love letter to 90s slashers with an impressive supernatural element. It’s a bit too derivative, and some of the characters aren’t written well, but it was a fun time, and I can’t wait to watch the other two, which I hear are even better.
Fear street is clever and a nail biting film that kicks off the trilogy.

Un film assez sympathique, le pitch de base est assez originaux, ce que j'ai bien aimé en particulier dans ce film c'est le fait que les anciens tueurs reviennent à chaque fois et qu'ils sont immortels, indestructibles.

La Malédiction de la Sorcière représente un réel danger, c'est comme si vous aviez Jason, Michael Myers, Leatherface etc... en mode immortel qui vous poursuivent à l'infini..

Bref, j'ai bien aimé ce côté-là, malheureusement, c'est aussi le principal côté positif du film, le jeu d'acteurs des personnages et à leurs images, c'est-à-dire très immature, et je n'ai personnellement pas trop accroché au film en lui même mais je reste fan de la trilogie.
I love rewatching this trilogy, but nothing beats going into it with no idea what I was about to witness.
Full of jump scares and eerie tones, Fear Street Part One may be the one to watch if you are into this genre. It's scary, bloody and has a supernatural storyline, which is hard to miss.
A thrilling start to the trilogy with some pretty intense moments and cool gory kills.-💀💩L
I finally saw in order the trilogy only after watching Prom Queen, and I liked them more than I thought. This one specially was entertaining

Se possível, eu gostaria de instituir um prêmio para o término mais bosta da história do cinema. E o pior: o filme ainda tenta me convencer de que a protagonista está certa. Pense comigo — tudo está dando errado, e agora, com o divórcio dos pais, tu tens a chance de sair da cidade, recomeçar e construir um futuro brilhante. Novas oportunidades, nova escola, tudo lindo! Massssss... tua namorada odeia a ideia e, honestamente, não parece nem um pouco preocupada com o que é melhor para ti. Fica bravinha porque tu estás prosperando e não assumiste tua sexualidade em pleno 1994, um ano super seguro e acolhedor, em que provavelmente tu não morrerias de porrada na rua.

   E falando na protagonista... ela é burra, sem tempero, uma tentativa forçada de me fazer importar com alguém que, sinceramente, é a primeira que eu gostaria que morresse. O esforço que o filme faz para manter de pé um relacionamento fadado ao fracasso é quase doloroso. As escolhas de absolutamente todos os personagens são questionáveis — com ênfase especial nessa protagonista aí.

   A customização dos anos 90 é legal, sim, rende um charme. Mas só isso.

   Me diverti brevemente enquanto assistia, confesso. Foi realmente uma pena que meu lado racional gritava em agonia tão alto que mal consegui ouvir os diálogos riquíssimos deste belíssimo filme.
The 90s were a good year, for FEAR. Solid story, engaging characters, & awesome slashers. Now I feel like I missed out just sticking with GOOSEBUMPS.
Pretty good.

The first ten minues were definitely the best with lots of action and suspense.  After that, there were lots of conversations that added little to none to the story.  It got better as it went on and led really well into a part 2.  Worth the watch but not worth the rewatch.
